metadata.synopsis: Barcus runs up to Wulbren in Haven after Wulbren is released from MOO. This is the culmination of everything he's been working for for the whole game and is so excited to see his friend - and find out what the deal wis with the runepowder plot. Barcus is swiftly rebuked by Wulbren and left disappointed but trying to save face.
metadata.how_to_trigger: - Free gnomes from MOO- Tell Barcus Wulbren is back- Follow and talk to either one of them.

67.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
67.text: Ah. I'd heard you might be about. How the devil did you get stuck here, Barcus?

1.speaker: Barcus Wroot
1.text: I'm not stuck. I came to find you, of course.
1.context: NodeContext: Faux chagrin but it's really happy to see Wulbren

61.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
61.text: Why would you do a foolish thing like that? Really, Barcus.
61.context: NodeContext: 'Really' in kind of sarcastic disbelief that Barcus would annoy him like this.

30.speaker: Barcus Wroot
30.text: Unfortunately for me, you're my friend. Rescuing you from mortal peril is my right.

34.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
34.text: But you didn't rescue me, did you? I rescued myself, with the aid of this - helper.
34.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wulbren waves a hand dismissively, indicating the player on 'helper'NodeContext: 'Helper' applies to the player. Wulbren is being dismissive of the player's ocntributions to his escape.

72.speaker: Barcus Wroot
72.text: Ah - it's you! I should've guessed. Thank you very much for your help finding Wulbren!

76.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
76.text: You don't belong here, Barcus. Soon as the way is clear, pack up and head to Baldur's Gate.

31.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
31.text: You don't belong here, Barcus. Soon as the Harpers give word that Moonrise has been handled, you ought to get out of here.

24.speaker: Barcus Wroot
24.text: But - Wulbren - the runepowder. We need to discuss what you're going to -
24.context: NodeContext: Barcus almost starting to plead here. There's a lot he wants to say to his friend but isn't being given the chance.

7.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
7.context: NodeContext: Wulbren snaps, losing his temper at Barcus' mention of runepowder.

57.speaker: Player
57.text: You don't know what Barcus has gone through to find you.

14.speaker: Barcus Wroot
14.context: NodeContext: Pleading with the player not to flatter him in front of Wulbren. Barcus' pride and humility.

41.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
41.text: Indeed. Neither of you has any clue what's a stake - and why should you? It's Ironhand Gnome business.
41.context: NodeContext: Frustration with Barcus and player, biting edge

39.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
39.text: If you'll excuse me, I have a great deal to do.
39.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wulbren turns away, leaves convo.

42.speaker: Barcus Wroot
42.context: NodeContext: Cowed but trying to keep his chin up.

35.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
35.text: Then it's settled. Good day to you both.
35.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wulbren turns away, leaves convo.

75.speaker: Barcus Wroot
75.text: Well! There we have it. Wulbren is safe and sound, thanks to you. I owe you a great deal.

81.speaker: Barcus Wroot
81.text: The Brilliant Retort, for starters. Here you are. I hope you'll like it.
81.context: CinematicNodeContext: Reach behind back to retrieve Brilliant Retort. Off-camera hand off to player.

54.speaker: Barcus Wroot
54.text: It's a new type of smokepowder. Powerful stuff. Made it myself.

43.speaker: Barcus Wroot
43.text: I give you: The Brilliant Retort!

18.speaker: Barcus Wroot
18.text: Now! I believe our business is well and truly concluded.

0.speaker: Player
0.text: You risked your life for Wulbren several times over - don't you think he should be a bit more grateful?

11.speaker: Barcus Wroot
11.text: There's no need for gratitude between Wulbren and myself. His interests are my interests, and vice versa.

20.speaker: Player
20.text: You don't owe me, Barcus. If anything, Wulbren does.

68.speaker: Barcus Wroot
68.text: You don't know him, though. This is just his way.

21.speaker: Player
21.text: You really care about him, don't you.

50.speaker: Barcus Wroot
50.text: Well! Once you're used to someone, you're... used to them.
50.context: NodeContext: subtext = he cares about wulbren more than anything in the world but is being barcusy about it

26.speaker: Barcus Wroot
26.text: Nonsense! When you've known each other as long as we have, there aren't sides.

55.speaker: Barcus Wroot
55.text: Wulbren can be a little sharp, but so can I - you should know that better than anyone.
55.context: NodeContext: With a touch of humour at the end.

73.speaker: Player
73.text: Wulbren seems like a real arsehole.

6.speaker: Barcus Wroot
6.text: Don't judge him too harshly. He's been through a lot. When he's had some rest, he'll be back to his usual self.

70.speaker: Player
70.text: What will you do now, Barcus?

23.speaker: Barcus Wroot
23.text: Well! Perhaps Wulbren is right. Perhaps I ought to return to Baldur's Gate.
23.context: NodeContext: False chipperness. He was hoping for a welcome reunion with Wulbren, and now he's being sent away after being humiliated.

19.speaker: Barcus Wroot
19.text: I'm glad you agree. Well! I'll just - erm - stand over there. In case Wulbren needs anything.

47.speaker: Player
47.text: That'll have to wait - it's lethal out there.

36.speaker: Barcus Wroot
36.text: That's all right. I'm a patient fellow. I'm sure you'll clear a path for everyone soon enough.
36.context: NodeContext: Talking about waiting for the curse to be cleared, but the subtext is he's patient in general and will continue to be so with Wulbren

17.speaker: Player
17.text: Why don't you join my camp once we're ready to leave these lands?

45.speaker: Barcus Wroot
45.text: Hm. Perhaps I will. Yes - yes that's a nice idea.

69.speaker: Player
69.text: I'm heading to the Towers to face Ketheric Thorm. We may not meet again.

40.speaker: Barcus Wroot
40.text: Oh. That's a little sad, isn't it?

32.speaker: Player
32.text: I'll tell you what: If I make it out alive, why don't you meet me at my camp afterward?

5.speaker: Player
5.text: With a little luck, I'll still see you at camp later.

53.speaker: Barcus Wroot
53.text: I certainly hope so, or Withers will be most despondent. Look after yourself.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: It is. Farewell, Barcus. And good luck.

10.speaker: Barcus Wroot
10.text: The very same to you. Though with your record, I very much doubt you'll need it.

4.speaker: Player
4.text: Not really. You're a bit of a wet blanket.

58.speaker: Barcus Wroot
58.text: Handy to have in the event of a fire, though. I'd say 'all the best' but we don't know each other that well, do we? All the most middling. Ta.

65.speaker: Barcus Wroot
65.text: The Brilliant Retort, for starters. Here you are, as promised.
65.context: CinematicNodeContext: Reach behind back to retrieve Brilliant Retort. Off-camera hand off to player.

29.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
29.context: NodeContext: Quietly furious, almost squaring up to player

27.speaker: Barcus Wroot
27.text: Let's not be uncivilised. Wulbren, perhaps we can talk more later, when you've had a moment to settle in.
27.context: NodeContext: Trying to play peacekeeper between the playe and Wulbren.

66.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
66.text: Sure. Now: I've business to attend to. Good day to you both.
66.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wulbren turns away, leaves convo.NodeContext: No interet in catching up with Barcus

71.speaker: Player
71.text: You can fight this out on your own time. Barcus, I believe you have something for me.

52.speaker: Barcus Wroot
52.text: Of course - but a moment, if you please. Wulbren, I believe we really must discuss -
52.context: NodeContext: Flustered; trying to fob off the player momentarily while he gets Wulbren to acknowledge him

80.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
80.text: Enough, Barcus. Pay your friend whatever it is you owe him and leave me out of it.
80.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wulbren turns away, leaves convo.NodeContext: Exasperated, wants to get away from this conversation.

25.speaker: Barcus Wroot
25.text: There we have it! Wulbren is safe and well, thanks to you. And as you so correctly pointed out, I owe you.
25.context: NodeContext: Faking cheerfulness after being rejected by Wulbren
